Title: Voces de la Frontera Anniversary Gala will celebrate 20 years of fighting for immigrant and worker rights
Excerpt: Voces de la Frontera will commemorate two decades of grassroots organizing for immigrant and workers rights during their 20th Anniversary Gala this Friday, Sept. 17 at the American Serb Hall in Milwaukee.

Title: OPINION: Milwaukee gives thanks: 3 reasons why we're grateful in 2021
Excerpt: My name is Alondra Garcia, and I am a bilingual elementary school teacher in Milwaukee Public Schools, a first-generation college graduate and an active member of my community. And I am DACAmented.

Title: Immigration reform blocked from reconciliation bill in Congress, but Democrats vow to try again
Excerpt: WASHINGTON ' The U.S. Senate parliamentarian has turned down a plan to include a pathway to citizenship for millions of undocumented people in the $3.5 trillion reconciliation package, a blow for Democrats and immigration advocacy groups when the decision was disclosed late Sunday.

Title: In Washington, saints join a crowd marching for immigration reform
Excerpt: WASHINGTON (CNS) ' Mario Ramirez of Milwaukee helped carry part of a homemade statue of Our Lady of Guadalupe that bobbed in the massive crowd headed toward the U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement building Sept. 21.

Title: COMMON COUNCIL HONORS HUMAN RIGHTS ACTIVISTS FOR AMPLIFYING THE NEED FOR MORE PATHWAYS TO CITIZENSHIP
Excerpt: As part of the series of special activities planned until October 15, Alderman Jos' G. P'rez and Alderwoman JoCasta Zamarripa released a joint statement on September 21, as a follow-up to the special recognition ceremony hosted in the Milwaukee Common Council chamber at City Hall.

Title: A deeper look at the Milwaukee area's census numbers puts faces on Latino growth, expanding diversity
Excerpt: When the U.S. Census Bureau released its 2020 data in mid-August, there was no picture of Maria Espino alongside the numbers for metropolitan Milwaukee.

Title: A Pathway for Undocumented Immigrants Is Essential
Excerpt: Thamara, who has been living in legal limbo since she fled the violence of Haiti two decades ago, has seen her high hopes turn into an uphill battle to get a pathway to citizenship. (Thamara, like many immigrants fearing deportation, wants to be identified only by her first name.)

Title: A More Perfect Union: Latinos, Minority Majorities, and Redistricting
Excerpt: According to the U.S. Census, Asian American & Pacific Islander and Latino populations grew significantly in some parts of country, while the white population decreased for the first time. Whites are still the largest racial group in the country.

Title: Deported and back again: How Ricardo Fierro made it back home to Racine
Excerpt: Ricardo Fierro wants to be here legally. He always has. For about two decades, he lived in the U.S. unperturbed. Then, one day, the U.S. government seemed to change its mind about how to treat immigrants like him.

Title: Latino Workers' Group Plans Strike to Pressure Democrats to Pass Immigration Reform
Quoted: Christine Neumann-Ortiz, Blanca Cano, John Rosenow
Excerpt: President Joe Biden and fellow Democrats campaigned in 2020 in part on the promise to deliver a path to citizenship for millions of undocumented essential workers.

Title: Parties in federal redistricting lawsuit filings debate continuation, dismissal
Excerpt: A federal court should continue moving forward with a possible redistricting trial as a backup in case state lawmakers and the Wisconsin Supreme Court fail to put a map in place in time to prepare for the 2022 elections, according to new filings.

Title: Immigrant rights advocates call for a general strike
Quoted: Blanca Cano, Eduardo Perea, Christine Neumann-Ortiz, John Rosenow
Excerpt: The immigrant rights group Voces de la Frontera on Tuesday announced plans for a statewide general strike to be held Monday, Oct. 11. The strike and student walkout, part of a series of nationwide days of action beginning on Monday, Indigenous People's Day, is intended to underscore the contributions of immigrants to the U.S. economy and pressure congressional Democrats

Title: 5 claves que alertan sobre el tiempo l'mite para aprobar ciudadan'a para indocumentados
Excerpt: Los defensores de los indocumentados libran esta semana una carrera contrarreloj para lograr incluir una reforma migratoria que favorezca a millones en el plan de gasto social de los dem'cratas, que deber'a aprobarse, seg'n expertos, antes de que culmine el mes de octubre.

Title: Se acaba el tiempo para lograr la aprobaci'n de una reforma migratoria
Excerpt: Los 'ngeles.- Los defensores de los indocumentados libran esta semana una carrera contrarreloj para lograr incluir una reforma migratoria que favorezca a millones en el plan de gasto social de los dem'cratas, que deber'a aprobarse, seg'n expertos, antes de que culmine el mes de octubre.

Title: Wisconsin immigrants to hold statewide strike for citizenship on Monday: 'Our time is now'
Quoted: Eduardo Perea, Blaca Cano, John Rosenow
Excerpt: Immigrant and Latino workers in Wisconsin plan to hold a statewide strike on Monday, Oct. 11, to both highlight the vital economic contributions of these communities and to continue calling on the Biden administration and congressional Democrats to deliver on their promise to pass a pathway to citizenship for millions of undocumented immigrants.

Title: Los negocios se unen a la marcha del 'D'a Sin Latinxs e Inmigrantes' o la marcha del 'Todo o Nada'
Excerpt: Mario Ram'rez de Organizador estatal de Voces de la Frontera inform' que a solo 2 d'as de la marcha, m's de 100 negocios y organizaciones ha reportado que cerrar'n para apoyar y asistir a la marcha del D'a Sin Latinxs e Inmigrantes. Las granjas tambi'n pueden reportar.

Title: A day without Latinx and immigrants': Hundreds in Wisconsin expected to strike, march on Monday
Excerpt: Organized by Voces de la Frontera, this action aims to increase economic and political pressure on President Biden, Vice President Harris and Congressional Democrats to deliver on their promise to pass a path to citizenship in the Build Back Better reconciliation budget bill this year.

Title: Day without Latinx happening Monday
Excerpt: APPLETON, Wis. On Monday, some Latinx businesses won't open and some Latinx people won't go to work or send their children to school.

Title: Strike Draws Attention To Issues Facing Undocumented Essential Workers
Excerpt: Earlier today, Voces de la Frontera ' a Milwaukee-based immigrant rights group ' organized a statewide strike to demonstrate the importance of Wisconsin's Latinx and immigrant communities and to draw attention to issues facing Wisconsin's undocumented essential workers.

Title: After being on the front line during COVID, hundreds of Wisconsin Latinx strike for immigration reform
Quoted: Ramiro Castillo, Sofia Fuentes, Renee Valdez, Basilisa Hernandez
Excerpt: Hundreds marched Monday from Milwaukee's south side to the Federal Courthouse in the statewide "Day without Latinx and immigrants" strike.

Title: After being on the front line during COVID, hundreds of Wisconsin Latinx strike for immigration reform
Quoted: Ramiro Castillo, Sofia Fuentes, Renee Valdez, Basilisa Hernandez
Excerpt: Hundreds marched Monday from Milwaukee's south side to the Federal Courthouse in the statewide "Day without Latinx and immigrants" strike.

Title: Se dispara cierre de negocios para apoyar la marcha en Milwaukee
Excerpt: Este domingo pasada la medianoche segu'an uni'ndose negocios al llamado de Voces de la Frontera de cerrar las puertas para apoyar la marcha del 'D'a Sin Latinxs e Inmigrantes'. El llamado lo encabezan algunos de los negocios latinos m's grandes de Wisconsin, llamado El Rey, que cerrar' varias de sus tiendas para unirse a la marcha

Title: Inmigrantes paran de trabajar y consumir en Wisconsin en protesta por una reforma migratoria
Quoted: Armando Ibarra, Alejandro Rivera, Luis Gutierrez, Irma Cisneros, Christine Neumann-Ortiz
Excerpt: Buena parte de los 450,000 latinos que viven en este estado se sumaron a la iniciativa del 'D'a sin inmigrantes', que busca llamar la atenci'n sobre la importancia de esta comunidad y la necesidad de una reforma migratoria que la tenga en cuenta.

Title: #DayWithoutLatinx: Hundreds take to the streets in Milwaukee to demand action on immigration
Quoted: Christine Neumann-Ortiz, Katherine Villanueva, Raul Varela
Excerpt: MILWAUKEE ' If you were driving near Mitchell Street all the way to the federal courthouse Monday morning, you may have seen hundreds of people marching for a pathway to citizenship.

Title: A Day Without Immigrants in Milwaukee march
Quoted: Marina Dimitrijevic, Miguel Maldonado, Sylvia (teacher), Brayan Carrera-Garcia
Excerpt: Several hundred, perhaps thousands of people marched Monday in Milwaukee.

Title: A political battle on Capitol Hill in Washington is getting some attention here in Wisconsin
Excerpt:
MILWAUKEE (CBS 58) -- A political battle on Capitol Hill in Washington is getting some attention here in Wisconsin.

We saw a march on Milwaukee's south side on what organizers call "A Day Without Immigrants."

Title: Day Without Immigrants Strike Advocates Pathway to Citizenship
Excerpt: Local activists organized a statewide immigrant strike Monday to advocate for reforms to the U.S. immigration system, including providing a pathway to citizenship for the millions of immigrants living and working in the country.

Title: Con 'Un D'a Sin Latinos' arranca en Milwaukee una jornada en apoyo a la ciudadan'a para indocumentados
Excerpt: M's de 150 negocios cierran sus puertas este lunes en Milwaukee (Wisconsin) en la primera jornada de 'Un D'a Sin Latinos', huelga que busca presionar a los dem'cratas del Congreso para que incluyan un camino a la ciudadan'a en el paquete de reconciliaci'n del presupuesto.

Title: El 31 de octubre es fecha clave en el Congreso para la ciudadan'a para indocumentados (podcast)
Excerpt: Esta semana se espera que la parlamentaria reciba el nuevo plan para integrar un camino a la ciudadan'a para millones de indocumentados en el proceso de Reconciliaci'n y activistas advierten que el 31 de octubre es la 'fecha l'mite' para que haya una decisi'n.

Title: Hundreds of protesters call for Biden to keep immigration promises
Excerpt: MILWAUKEE ' Hundreds marched three miles Monday from Milwaukee's south side to the downtown federal courthouse, chanting messages aimed at President Joe Biden's lack of action on immigration reform.

Title: Organizaciones e inmigrantes exigen a dem'cratas cumplir su promesa de ciudadan'a para indocumentados
Excerpt: Desde el 11 de octubre hasta el 31 de octubre 'fecha l'mite que estableci' la presidenta de la C'mara de Representantes, Nancy Pelosi para la votaci'n de los proyectos de ley de infraestructura y 'construir mejor' (Build Back Better)' organizaciones que defienden a inmigrantes har'n manifestaciones en distintas partes del pa's.

Title: STATEWIDE STRIKE DEMANDS CONGRESS RATIFY PATH TO CITIZENSHIP FOR IMMIGRANT ESSENTIAL WORKERS
Excerpt: Thousands of supporters marched, sometimes during periods of heavy rain, from Milwaukee's Latinx-majority southside to the federal courthouse downtown for a closing rally. Others in the growing Latinx and immigrant workforce participated by refusing to work, go to school, or make any purchases the entire day.

Title: Voces de la Frontera: Over 4,000 participated in 'Day Without Latinxs & Immigrants' strike in Wisconsin yesterday, increasing pressure on Democrats to pass citizenship for millions this year
Quoted: Christine Neumann-Ortiz, Rafaela Flores, Ramiro Castillo, Arianna Macias
Excerpt: (MILWAUKEE, WI) ' Yesterday, in just one week of organizing, an estimated 4,000 immigrant and Latinx essential workers, more than 130 small businesses and over 200 students from across Wisconsin participated in a Day Without Latinxs and Immigrants statewide general strike and march in Milwaukee.

Title: Immigrant workers and their families demand reform from Democrats
Quoted: Christine Neumann-Ortiz, Hiram Rabadan, Alondra Garcia, Arianna Macias
Excerpt: In honor of Indiginous People's Day, hundreds participated in a march on Milwaukee's Federal Building to demand that Democrats deliver on promises made to undocumented workers and their families. The march, led by Voces de la Frontera, was organized as part of the Day Without Immigrants general strike, during which people of all ages walked out of work and school to show the economic power of Wisconsin's immigrant workforce.

Title: Organizaciones e inmigrantes exigen a dem'cratas cumplir su promesa de ciudadan'a para indocumentados
Excerpt: Desde el 11 de octubre hasta el 31 de octubre 'fecha l'mite que estableci' la presidenta de la C'mara de Representantes, Nancy Pelosi para la votaci'n de los proyectos de ley de infraestructura y 'construir mejor' (Build Back Better)' organizaciones que defienden a inmigrantes har'n manifestaciones en distintas partes del pa's.

Title: Indocumentados que reporten abuso laboral podr'an obtener perd'n de deportaci'n y permiso de trabajo

Title: Dem'cratas contra la pared: activistas les exigen cumplir promesa de ciudadan'a para indocumentados
Excerpt: Los dem'cratas 'deben cumplir, sin excusas, sus promesas' de lograr la aprobaci'n de una reforma migratoria o, en caso contrario, rendir'n cuentas en las elecciones ante millones de votantes, afirmaron grupos que abogan por la legalizaci'n de unos 11 millones de migrantes indocumentados.

Title: Activistas planean demonstraci'n para presionar a dem'cratas para incluir reformas migratorias en ley de gastos sociales
Excerpt: MILWAUKEE (TELEMUNDO WISCONSIN) -- Antes de un voto de la C'mara de Representantes sobre el plan de gastos sociales del Presidente Joe Biden, grupos de apoyo de inmigrantes planean a presionar dem'cratas a actuar sobre una ventana de oportunidad que est' cerrando r'pidamente para incluir reformas migratorias en el proyecto de ley.

Title: Activists plan last-ditch effort to pressure Senate Democrats to act on immigration reform
Excerpt: MILWAUKEE (CBS 58) -- Ahead of an expected House vote on President Joe Biden's social spending plan, immigrant advocacy groups plan to pressure Democrats to act on a rapidly closing window of opportunity to include immigration reform proposals in the bill.

Title: Biden a favor de ciudadan'a para indocumentados, pero deja la decisi'n al Congreso
Excerpt: El presidente Biden mantiene su apoyo a una protecci'n migratoria para millones de indocumentados, pero no est' involucrado en la decisi'n del Congreso, donde un plan sigue en duda, debido a la parlamentaria Elizabeth MacDonough

Title: Biden a favor de ciudadan'a para indocumentados, pero deja la decisi'n al Congreso
Excerpt: El presidente Joe Biden mantiene su apoyo a un camino a la ciudadan'a para millones de inmigrantes indocumentados, pero ha decidido no involucrarse en la decisi'n final del Congreso.

Title: When immigrants are under attack what do we do?
Excerpt: when immigrants are under attack what do we do? stand up fight back."an immigrant-rights group staged a demonstration outside senator tammy baldwin's office in downtown milwaukee this afternoon.

Title: Voces for Immigrant Rights and a Path to Citizenship
Quoted: Christine Neumann-Ortiz, Andre Walton, Leslie Flores
Excerpt: Voces de la Frontera continues to remind everyone, including the Biden administration, that the fight for immigration reform continues. With only days remaining before Speaker Pelosi's October 31 deadline to pass the Build Back Better reconciliation bill, Voces de la Frontera and allies organized a public protest on Thursday, October 28 at 4:00 P.M., outside of  Senator Tammy Baldwin's Milwaukee office.

Title: Democrats pressured to keep their promises to immigrant voters
Quoted: Christine Neumann-Ortiz, Leslie Flores, Andre Walton
Excerpt: Organizations allied with Latino and immigrant communities are keeping up the pressure on the Biden administration and Democrats to deliver on immigration reform. On Oct. 28, the immigrant workers' rights group Voces de la Frontera organized a rally outside the office of Sen. Tammy Baldwin in Milwaukee, shutting down the street.

Title: Maps, districts, and Wisconsin's political future: A redistricting primer
Excerpt: MADISON, Wis. ' When Gov. Tony Evers 'People's Map's Commission' opened an online portal for Wisconsinites to submit their ideas for the state's next redistricting plan, Middleton resident Bill Taylor began conceptualizing a plan.

Title: This is really the end of the line': immigration advocates press for reform in Build Back Better Budget
Excerpt: WASHINGTON, D.C. ' Pressure from advocacy groups grows as Senate rules make it harder for Democrats to keep their promise of sweeping immigration reform in a massive spending bill the party spent months crafting.

Title: Protesters Push For Federal Immigration Reform
Quoted: Luis Velasquez, Carlos Perez, Jung Woo Kim
Excerpt: This afternoon, demonstrators gathered outside the office of Senator Tammy Baldwin to demand action on immigration reform. Numbering a few dozen, they blocked off traffic in a corner of the capitol square for more than an hour.

Title: '11 Cities for 11 Million' advocates rally for immigrant rights
Excerpt: MADISON, Wis. ' Advocates outside Senator Tammy Baldwin's office Thursday called for legislators to make sure undocumented immigrants and Dreamers have a path to citizenship.

Title: Voces Protests Change in Biden Bill
Excerpt: The immigrant workers' rights group Voces de la Frontera is planning a series of protests to demand a path to citizenship be included in the massive Build Back Better Act, which passed the House of Representatives on Friday and now heads to the U.S. Senate.

Title: Conductor sin identificar mat' con su auto a 5 personas en desfile navide'o de Wisconsin
Excerpt: Estados Unidos.- Luego de que un hombre atropellara a un grupo de personas durante un festival navide'o en Waukesha, Wisconsin, donde mat' a cinco y dej' 40 heridos, hasta el momento no se conoce la identidad del responsable.

Title: OPINION: Milwaukee gives thanks: 3 reasons why we're grateful in 2021
Excerpt:
With another challenging year drawing to an end, it's worth taking the time to give gratitude.

So we asked contributors to our 'Community Voices' column to name a person, organization or institution for which they feel thankful.

Title: Voces de la Frontera manda cartas pidiendo camino hacia la ciudadan'a
Quoted: Angel (7 y/o), Alondra Garcia, Maria Mota, Christine Neumann-Ortiz
Excerpt: MILWAUKEE (TELEMUNDO WI) -- Hoy (mi'rcoles 24 de noviembre) Voces de la Frontera estuvo en varias ciudades en el estado entregando cartas pidiendo un camino a la ciudadan'a a representantes del estado como la Senadora Tammy Baldwin y congresista Gwen Moore.

Title: 'No Thanksgiving without immigrants' Advocates join undocumented workers, familes to call on Democrats to deliver a pathway to citizenship now
Quoted: Angel, Cassandra Casas, Christine Neumann-Ortiz, Giovanni Martinez, Maria Mota
Excerpt: Immigration activists and the families of undocumented workers showed up  in Green Bay, Madison and Milwaukee outside the offices of Sen. Tammy Baldwin and Congresswoman Gwen Moore. Their message, aimed to keep the pressure on Democrats to provide a pathway to citizenship in the Build Back Better plan that passed the House and now moves to the Senate, was, 'No Thanksgiving without immigrants, citizenship for my parents.'

Title: Voces de la Frontera urges Mayor Barrett to veto Milwaukee aldermanic district maps, pushing for more Latino representation
Excerpt: Immigrants rights organization Voces de la Frontera is urging Mayor Tom Barrett to veto aldermanic district maps the Common Council approved on Nov. 23.

Title: Barrett Pushed To Veto New Council Map
Excerpt:
The City of Milwaukee's redistricting process might not be over yet.

Voces de la Frontera, a Latino-focused immigrant and workers' rights organization, is calling for Mayor Tom Barrett to veto the council's map and adopt one targeted at creating a third majority Latino district within the decade.

Title: Voces de la Frontera pide al alcalde que vete nuevos mapas de distritos concejales
Excerpt: MILWAUKEE (TELEMUNDO WI)-- Voces de la Frontera le est' pidiendo al Alcalde de Milwaukee Tom Barrett que vete los mapas de los distritos municipales de Milwaukee, presionando para que haya m's representaci'n latina.
